qas.question: What percent of copper is recyclable?
What percentage of copper that has been mined is still being used today?
What other metal besides copper is 100% recyclable?
Name a metal that is recycled more often than copper?
What is the amount of copper in use, per capita, globally?
What percent of copper is indestructible?
What percentage of copper that has been mined is still in the air today?
What other wood besides copper is 100% recyclable?
What is the amount of copper stolen, per capita, globally?

context: Like <a2_0>aluminium<a2_0/>, copper is <a0_0><b5_0>100%<b5_0/><a0_0/> recyclable without any loss of quality, regardless of whether it is in a raw state or contained in a manufactured product. In volume, copper is the third most recycled metal after iron and <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>aluminium<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>. It is estimated that <a1_0><b6_0>80%<b6_0/><a1_0/> of the copper ever mined is still in use today. According to the International Resource Panel's Metal Stocks in Society report, the global per capita stock of copper in use in society is <a4_0><b9_0>35–55 kg<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Much of this is in more-developed countries (140–300 kg per capita) rather than less-developed countries (30–40 kg per capita).
